page.title: 04PUBLIC TRANSPORT
page.content:
A vast network of public road transport is provided by West Yorkshire's{Metro}system. These{buses} provide transport facilities in even the most remote areas. The buses are regular and fares are low in cost.
The terrain makes it difficult to build railways, since the gradients ars far from ideal. The{railway}that ran along the valley bottom was closed some years ago.
The proximity of the M62{motorway}has had a profound effect upon the area. It is possible to travel by road to Leeds, Bradford, or Manchester in about a half hour.
